results.title: Silk and strings: a tale of Taiwan
results.creator_credit: Bay Street Pictures Inc and Seabourne Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian Notebook”.
Presents traditional aspects of Taiwanese culture. Contrasts the simple life, costumes, and art and crafts of the original natives of Taiwan with the culture of the Chinese. Focuses on the traditions of China as they are retained in Taiwan, including the cultivation of the arts, music, and calligraphy.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Bay Street Pictures Inc and Seabourne Enterprises

results.title: Thailand - do good receive good, do evil receive evil
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, ABC, Film Australia and University of Queensland Press
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
A look at the historical and cultural background of Thailand - this film attempts to address racist preconceptions about Thai people and their beliefs and rituals. Concentrates on two elements that affect all Thais: Buddhism and the role of the monarchy. It points out how the Monks appear to be losing their leadership roles as Thai society becomes more urbanised and how the Government is attempting to inform the Monks about social change so they don’t lose their place in society. Includes one or two scenes of violence (burning bodies, slaughter etc.) from newsreels. Presented by John Temple.
results.title_for_label: Thailand - do good receive good, do evil receive evil
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, ABC, Film Australia and University of Queensland Press

results.title: Japan: the bamboo bends and does not break
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, ABC and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
Provides insight into the historical and cultural background of Japan, drawing attention to the sense of duty and obligation held by the Japanese in ways that are different from people in the West. Photography by Dean Semler. Unit Manager: Damien Parer.

results.title: Indonesia
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, ABC, Film Australia and University of Queensland Press
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
What makes this diverse chain of islands into a nation? Indonesia’s national motto “Unity in diversity” is the film’s starting point in its concentration on Sumatra, Java and Bali - the most populated areas. One of the most interesting sequences is an examination of the Indonesian concept of power - that there is a finite amount of it in the world. Another highlight is the Indonesian Army and its role as an essential ingredient in society - not, as so often in the West, as something appended to, or imposed on, society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, ABC, Film Australia and University of Queensland Press

Another highlight is the Indonesian Army and its role as an essential ingredient in society - not, as so often in the West, as something appended to, or imposed on, society.
